routes.documentation: Returns the full information for a given episode id. __Deprecation Warning:__ The _director_ key will be deprecated in favor of the new _directors_ key in a future release.

responses.label: An array of query keys as strings
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given episode ID does not exist.

routes.documentation: All available languages. These language abbreviations can be used in the `Accept-Language` header for routes that return translation records.

responses.label: An array of language objects.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

routes.documentation: Information about a particular language, given the language ID.

responses.label: An array of language objects.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given language ID does not exist.

routes.documentation: Returns a session token to be included in the rest of the requests. Note that API key authentication is required for all subsequent requests and user auth is required for routes in the `User` section

responses.label: Returns a JWT token for use with the rest of the API routes
Invalid credentials and/or API token

routes.documentation: Returns a movies records that contains all information known about a particular movies id.

responses.label: A movie record.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: Returns all movies ids updated since a given timestamp.

responses.label: All movies ids updated since a given date
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Missing query params are given
Invalid query params provided

routes.documentation: Refreshes your current, valid JWT token and returns a new token. Hit this route so that you do not have to post to `/login` with your API key and credentials once you have already been authenticated.

responses.label: Returns a new token to use in your subsequent requests
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

routes.documentation: Allows the user to search for a series based on the following parameters.

responses.label: An array of results that match the provided query.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no records are found that match your query.

routes.documentation: Returns an array of parameters to query by in the `/search/series` route.

responses.label: An array of query keys as strings
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

routes.documentation: Returns a series records that contains all information known about a particular series id.

responses.label: A series record.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: Returns header information only about the given series ID.

responses.label: Series header information. Good for getting the Last-Updated header to find out when the series was last modified.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: Returns actors for the given series id

responses.label: An array of actor objects for the given series id.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: All episodes for a given series. Paginated with 100 results per page.

responses.label: An array of episode objects for the given series id.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: This route allows the user to query against episodes for the given series. The response is a paginated array of episode records.

responses.label: An array of basic Episode results that matched the query
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

routes.documentation: Returns the allowed query keys for the `/series/{id}/episodes/query` route

responses.label: An array of query keys as strings
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

routes.documentation:
Returns a summary of the episodes and seasons available for the series.

__Note__: Season "0" is for all episodes that are considered to be specials.

responses.label: A summary of the episodes and seasons avaialable for the given series.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: Returns a series records, filtered by the supplied comma-separated list of keys. Query keys can be found at the `/series/{id}/filter/params` route.

responses.label: A filtered series record
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: Returns the list of keys available for the `/series/{id}/filter` route

responses.label: A list of keys to filter by
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: Returns a summary of the images for a particular series

responses.label: A summary of the image types and counts available for the given series.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist

routes.documentation: Query images for the given series ID.

responses.label: An array of basic Episode results that matched the query
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

routes.documentation: Returns the allowed query keys for the `/series/{id}/images/query` route. Contains a parameter record for each unique `keyType`, listing values that will return results.

responses.label: An array of query keys as strings
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

routes.documentation:
Returns an array of series that have changed in a maximum of one week blocks since the provided `fromTime`.


The user may specify a `toTime` to grab results for less than a week. Any timespan larger than a week will be reduced down to one week automatically.

responses.label: An array of Update objects that match the given timeframe.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no records exist for the given timespan

routes.documentation: Returns an array of valid query keys for the `/updated/query/params` route.

responses.label: An array of Update objects that match the given timeframe.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no records exist for the given timespan

routes.documentation: Returns basic information about the currently authenticated user.

responses.label: User information.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no information exists for the current user

routes.documentation: Returns an array of favorite series for a given user, will be a blank array if no favorites exist.

responses.label: User favorites.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no information exists for the current user

routes.documentation: Deletes the given series ID from the user’s favorite’s list and returns the updated list.

responses.label: List of user favorites.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no information exists for the current user
Returned if requested record could not be deleted

routes.documentation: Adds the supplied series ID to the user’s favorite’s list and returns the updated list.

responses.label: List of user favorites.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no information exists for the current user
Returned if requested record could not be updated

routes.documentation: Returns an array of ratings for the given user.

responses.label: Array of user ratings.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no information exists for the current user

routes.documentation: Returns an array of ratings for a given user that match the query.

responses.label: List of user ratings that match the given query.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no information exists for the current user

routes.documentation: Returns a list of query params for use in the `/user/ratings/query` route.

responses.label: Parameters to use for querying.
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no information exists for the current user

routes.documentation: This route deletes a given rating of a given type.

responses.label: Returns OK if the delete was successful
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no rating is found that matches your given parameters

routes.documentation: This route updates a given rating of a given type.

responses.label: Update OK if the update was successful
Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired
Returned if no rating is found that matches your given parameters
